section.title: Introduction
section.para:
Users who run clients can programatically set up the authorization scheme to enforce
on a per invocation basis. The properties and
configuration information required depends on the configured
authorization scheme.
describes the configuration steps in more detail.

listitem.para: Using self authorization: Ensure that the client is running with same credentials as effective server-side credential (resource, service, container credential, in the order of occurance).

Using host authorization:
Ensure that the effective server-side credential (resource, service, container credential, in the order of occurance) is host credential of the machine on which the service is running.
Ensure that the client is not using 127.0.0.1 as host address to access to the service, but the actual host name.
Using identity authorization: Ensure that the DN matches the server's DN exactly. If using command line interface quotes might have to be place around the DN string for spaces to be maintained.

section.title: No authorization with delegation fails
section.para: On using GSI Secure Conversation delegation of credentials cannot be done if no authorization of the server is done (that is if client side authorization is set to none). Use any other form of authorization while delegating.
Alternatively, Delegation Service can be used to delegate credentials, in a scenario where delegated credentials are required by no authorization of server is required.

important.para: Delegating credentials without authorizing server is not recommended since a malicious server can obtain the client's credential.
